Title: Pilot Soil Monitoring and Incentives Program
Description: Development of an offline data collection application for the Commonwealth Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry under the direction of the CSIRO Australian National Soils Information Systems Project for the Pilot Soils Monitoring and Incentives Program using the technology we developed for FAIMS 3.
Authors: Ross, S., P. Crook, B. Ballsun-Stanton, S. Cassidy, and N. Lorente

Title: Racially and ethnically motivated violent extremist (REMVE) Online Research
Description: Investigators carried out a research study analysing online racially and ethnically motivated violent extremist (REMVE) information ecosystems in Australia for the RESOLVE Network at USIP.
Authors: Ballsun-Stanton, B., L. Waldek, and J. Droogan

Grant: Department of Communities and Justice, NSW – Partner Funded Research
Title: An examination of Australian Violent Extremism in the context of the Covid-19 Pandemic
Description: This project seeks to continue the examination of online extremism in NSW and Australia in the context of the global Covid-19 pandemic and its broad social and economic consequences. It will use data from online and offline sources to chart the spread of online right-wing extremist themes and narratives both online and within wider mainstream Australian society.
Authors: Ballsun-Stanton, B., L. Waldek, and J. Droogan

Grant: Department of Defence, Commonwealth of Australia
Title: DSP Multi-Party Collaborative Project Agreement in relation to the undertaking of three case studies of Mass Influence Organisations
Description: Consultative commissioned research on behalf of lead institutions into Facebook and online influence.
Authors: Schreer, B., L. Waldek, J. Droogan, and B. Ballsun-Stanton

Grant: National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy / ARDC
Title: FAIMS 3.0 Electronic Field Notebooks: A platform for field research supporting digital data capture and management in diverse situations
Description: Deploying and reengineering the FAIMS project to allow modern multiple-OS offline field data collection, better FAIR data support, and compatibility with 2020's devices.
Authors: S. Ross, L. Betbeder-Matibet, G. Karskens, P. Crook, N. Stern, M. Salmon, L. Wyborn, A. Sobotkova, J. Klump, R. Fraser, S. Theil, K. Robertson, J. Lehner, G. S. Heinson, R. Parkes, R. Flad, P. VanValkenburgh, J. Thompson, E. Kansa, C. Nicholson, G. Aben, B. Ballsun-Stanton, and S. Cassidy

Grant: Department of Communities and Justice – Partner Funded Research
Title: Mapping networks and narratives of far-right social movements in New South Wales
Description: Social media data collection and analysis on Twitter and Gab of posts by Right Wing Extremists in New South Wales, to generate a summary of the environment and policy suggestions for senior civil servants in the NSW State Government.
Authors: Droogan, J., L. Waldek, B. Ballsun-Stanton, M. Peucker, D. Smith, M.Iqbal

Title: Indigenous foodways in colonial Cape York Peninsula
Description: Trace historical Indigenous foodways in colonial Cape York Peninsula, Queensland, through a program of collaborative community-based archaeological and anthropological research.
Authors: Morrison, M., D. McNaughton, H. Burke, I. Moffat, S. Ross, A. Sobotkova, B. Asmussem, B. Ballsun-Stanton, and D. Claudie

Grant: New South Wales Government Research Attraction \& Acceleration Program
Title: Field Acquired Information Manage-ment Systems (FAIMS) project
Description: Continue development of the Federated Archaeological Information Systems Project, especially customisation and deployment at participating fieldwork projects.
Authors: Ross, S., A. Sobotkova, B. Ballsun-Stanton

Grant: National eResearch Collaboration Tools and Resources, eResearch Tools program
Title: User support for Virtual Laboratories and eResearch Tools
Description: Improve documentation for the Federated Archaeological Information Management Systems Project.
Authors: Ballsun-Stanton, B., A. Sobotkova, and S. Ross

Grant: Australian Research Council Linkage, Infrastructure, Equipment and Facilities Grant
Title: Federated archaeological information management systems project: transforming archaeological research through digital technologies
Description: Continue development of the Federated Archaeological Information Systems Project, especially customisation and deployment at participating fieldwork projects.
Authors: Ross, S., D. Curnoe, J. Field, M. Letnic, S. Mooney, J. Hunter, A. Fairbairn, M. Weisler, T. Manne, J. Thompson, I. Johnson, M. Gibbs, T. Murray, J. Webb, N. Stern, D. Frankel, H. Burke, M. Morrison, I. Davidson, W. Boyd, J. Thurbon, A. Brin, E. Kansa, S. Schloen, J. Richards

Grant: National eResearch Collaboration Tools and Resources, eResearch Tools program
Title: Federated Archaeological Information Management Systems
Description: Development of mobile device applications, database interoperability tools, knowledge discovery strategies, and other resources for archaeological information management. NeCTAR is an Australian Government project and Super Science initiative financed by the Education Investment Fund.
Authors: Ross, S., A. Sobotkova, P. Crook, and B. Ballsun-Stanton.
